intro: Disterigma pallidum, commonly known as the pale disterigma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The flowers produce a capsule fruit containing numerous small seeds.
